screen_name: I volunteered to participate in an FDA-approved COVID-19 antibodies trial - and my test results just came through positive! High antibody count, confirming I had the Corona virus when I was diagnosed with pneumonia, weeks ago. Hopefully will be able to now donate blood to help! https://t.co/6hGVPskGVP

We can’t assume immunity, but either way, we can’t even begin to mobilize this potentially amazing resource in the battle against the Covid-19 virus, because of both the limits to current serological testing, but also as a legacy of the non-testing 'screw up' to this point.

Since I shared my recent Guardian article about my unsuccessful struggles to get a Covid-19 test here in New York City, I have been blown away by the messages of support, expressions of concern and offers of assistance. Thank you everyone - I am so cared for!

We can’t assume immunity, but either way, we can’t even begin to mobilize this potentially amazing resource in the battle against the Covid-19 virus, because of both the limits to current serological testing, but also as a legacy of the non-testing screw up to this point.

Since I shared my recent Guardian article about my unsuccessful struggles to get a Covid-19 test here in New York City, I have been blown away by the messages of support, expressions of concern and offers of assistance. Thank you everyone - I am so cared for!

If I have recovered from Corona, then I may have antibodies, some immunity and an ability to help others, through donating plasma, etc. On the other hand, if I didn’t have Covid-19, then my pneumonia, mild asthma and age, make me particularly vulnerable if infected.

I still haven’t been tested, so no idea if my recovery is due to antibiotics dealing with a bacterial pneumonia, or if I have recovered after having the corona virus. This raises a new set of dilemmas that emerge from the debacle of this bungling of testing processes in the US.

After this generous outpouring of solidarity, I wanted to tweet a quick update thread. Since writing the Guardian piece, my health has been steadily improving. For a week I haven’t had a fever, my cough has largely cleared up, and I feel I am well on the road to recovery. But...

After this generous outpouring of solidarity, I wanted to tweet a quick update thread. Since writing the Guardian piece, my health has been steadily improving. For a week I haven’t had a fever, my cough has largely cleared up, and I feel I am well on the road to recovery.

@BernForBernie20 @HardballChris Hey @HardballChris don’t stop there! How about the outrageous reference to Cold War rhetoric and your wild imaginations about executions in Central Park? Whether by reference to Nazis or “reds”, these prejudiced tropes are biased and dangerous. Time to go!
